uint32 getCurrentMicroTime (   ) 
 

Get the current time in microseconds.

This time wraps quite often so only short intervals can be measured!

Returns:
Current Time in microseconds.

Referenced by DebugClockMicro::getTime().

uint32 getCurrentTime (   ) 
 

Get the current time in milliseconds.

The time wraps every 1193 minute (=49.7 days) so no timedifferance may be longer than that.

Returns:
Relative time in milliseconds.

Referenced by DebugClock::getTime(), Packet::getTimeSinceArrival(), and Packet::setArrivalTime().

uint32 getRealTime (   ) 
 

Get the current real time in seconds since 00:00:00 1 January 1970, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Use gmtime, localtime and strftime to get more human times.

Returns:
The number of elapsed seconds since 00:00:00 1 Jan 1970.

Referenced by DebugClockSeconds::getTime().

void startTestTime (  uint32  autoIncreaseTime = 0  ) 
 

Causes the functions in TimeUtility to follow simulated time instead of using the system clock.

This is meant to be used in testing.

Parameters:
autoIncreaseTime Each read of time will cause the test time to increase by this many ms.
